page.title: 10Our Area 40 Years Ago.
page.content: 40 years ago our school was farmland owned by the farms, one at the top and one at the bottom. There were a few houses in Green Lane. There was Lisa's street called Jubilee Street and Sarah's street called Park View Terrace. There was a footpath starting at Wolseley Road going through the fields to Fortescue Lane. There were a few houses going down Wolseley Road. The sewage works was a Prisoner of War Camp for the Italians. After the war it was a Resettlement Camp for people from other countries. Etching Hill was nearly all farmland. The Wolseley Arms Inn was called the Roebuck Inn. The canal bridge at Wolseley Bridge was a hump backed bridge. The main A51 road was not so busy and traffic did not travel so fast. The railway trains were all pulled by steam locomotives and there were working boats on the canal.
